sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Of gentylnes and nobylyte A dyaloge betwen the marchaut the knyght and the plowman dysputyng who is a verey gentylman [et] who is a noble man and how men shuld come to auctoryte, compiled in maner of an enterlude with diuers toys [et] gestis addyd therto to make mery pastyme and disport. Rastell, John, d. 1536.
[28] p.
Joh[ann]es rastell me fieri fecit, [[London] : [ca. 1525]]
By John Rastell. Caption title. Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC. In verse. Signatures: A⁶ B-C⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
